20.a: They will stagger, they will not defeat him, and they will have unending shame.
20.q: What will happen to those who watch for Jeremiah to fall?

20.a: Everyone should sing and praise Yahweh because he examines the righteous, sees their mind and heart, does vengeance, and rescues the oppressed person.
20.q: Why does Jeremiah say to sing and praise Yahweh?

20.a: He curses the day he was born and asks that it not be blessed.
20.q: How does Jeremiah say about the day he was born?

21.a: They asked him to seek advice from Yahweh.
21.q: What did Pashhur and Zephaniah ask Jeremiah?

21.a: They were hoping Yahweh would do miracles for them.
21.q: Why did they want Jeremiah to seek advice from Yahweh?

21.a: The message is that Yahweh will fight against Zedekiah.
21.q: What is the message that Jeremiah give Zedekiah?

21.a: Yahweh will fight against King Zedekiah with sickness, war, and hunger.
21.q: How will Yahweh fight against King Zedekiah?

21.a: They needed to go out of the city and surrender to the Chaldeans.
21.q: What did people who wanted to live need to do?
What would happen to the people who stayed in the city?

21.a: He wants the king to listen to Yahweh's word, to bring about justice, and to rescue the oppressed.
21.q: What does Yahweh want the king of Judah to do?

21.a: Yahweh is against the people who live in the valley and on the plain.
He will light a fire in the thickets that will burn everything up.
21.q: What will Yahweh do because of what the people are doing?

22.a: They are to listen to the word of Yahweh, act justly, help those who have been robbed, and rescue the oppressed. They are not to mistreat foreigners, orphans, or widows, and they are not to be violent or kill innocent people.
22.q: What does Yahweh tell the King of Judah, his servants, and his people to do?

22.a: The royal palace will become a ruin.
22.q: What happens if they do not listen to these words of Yahweh's declaration?

22.a: Yahweh will choose people to come and destroy it.
22.q: How will the palace become a wilderness?

22.a: He has done them because the people abandoned the covenant and worshiped other gods.
22.q: Why has Yahweh done these things to the great city?

22.a: They should weep because the captives will never return or see the land again.
22.q: Why should the people weep for those who go into captivity?

22.a: He should do justice even for the poor and needy, do righteousness, and know Yahweh.
22.q: What should a good king do?

22.a: They will not lament because he steals, he kills innocent people, and he oppresses people.
22.q: Why will the people not lament for king Jehoiakim?

22.a: They will bury him as they bury donkeys.
22.q: What kind of burial will they give Jehoiakim?

22.a: They have not listened to Yahweh's voice.
22.q: What has been the custom of the people since they were young?

22.a: They will lose their shepherds, their friends will become captives, and they will be ashamed and humiliated.
22.q: What will happen to them when they do not listen?

22.a: Yahweh will give Jehoiachin to the king of Babylon, and he will die far away from the land.
Jehoiachin will be childless and will not prosper.
22.q: What does Yahweh say about Jehoiachin?

23.a: The shepherds destroy and scatter the sheep, drive them away, and do not care for them.
23.q: What do the shepherds of Jeremiah's day do to the sheep?

23.a: He will gather them, give them a place to graze, and give them good shepherds.
23.q: What does Yahweh declare he will do for his flock?

23.a: He will raise up a righteous king.
23.q: What will Yahweh do in the coming days?

23.a: They will say Yahweh has brought them back from other lands so they can live in their own land.
23.q: What will the people say Yahweh has done for them?

23.a: His heart is broken because Yahweh's words are holy, but the prophets are liars and the land is full of adulterers.
23.q: Why is Jeremiah's heart broken?

23.a: Yahweh will push them down and disaster will come against them.
23.q: What will happen to the prophets and priests?

23.a: They prophesied by Baal, led Yahweh's people off the right path, committed adultery, deceived the people, and encouraged the people to do evil.
23.q: What are the offensives of the prophets?

23.a: He makes them eat wormwood and drink poisonous water.
23.q: What does Yahweh make these prophets do?

23.a: They have lied to the people.
23.q: Why does Yahweh say, "Do not listen to the prophets"?

23.a: His fury is like a storm.
23.q: What is Yahweh's fury like?

23.a: Yahweh did not send them.
23.q: What is wrong with the prophets?

23.a: There is nowhere people can get away from him. He nearby and far away, he can see in every secret place, and he is everywhere in the heavens and the earth.
23.q: Where can people go to get away from Yahweh?

23.a: They want the people to stop worshiping Yahweh.
23.q: What do the prophets want the people to do?

23.a: He is to declare Yahweh's word truthfully and not steal words from other people.
23.q: How is the prophet of Yahweh to declare what he hears from Yahweh?

23.a: He is against them because they deceive people by saying that their own thoughts are the words of Yahweh.
23.q: Why is Yahweh against the prophets?

23.a: He is to say that there is no word from Yahweh because Yahweh has abandoned the people.
23.q: What does Yahweh want Jeremiah to tell those who ask him for a word from Yahweh?

23.a: He will punish those who say they have a message from Yahweh.
23.q: Whom will Yahweh punish?

23.a: They must not do it because each man is using his own words, and they have perverted the words of the living God.
23.q: Why must the people not talk to each other about Yahweh's declaration?

23.a: He asks questions to see if they falsely say that they have received a declaration from Yahweh.
23.q: How does Jeremiah test any prophet?

23.a: Yahweh will throw them away and put everlasting shame on them.
23.q: What happens to the prophets who give false reports?

24.a: Yahweh showed him a basket of very good figs and a basket of very bad figs.
24.q: What is the vision Yahweh gave Jeremiah?

24.a: Yahweh says the exiles are like the good figs.
24.q: Who are the people Yahweh says are like the good figs?

24.a: He will restore them to the land
24.q: What will Yahweh do to the people who are like the good figs?

24.a: Zedekiah, the people who remain in the land, and the people who go to Egypt are like the bad figs.
24.q: Who are the people Yahweh says are like the bad figs?

24.a: He will make things go badly for them, and he will kill them by war, famine, and sickness.
24.q: What will Yahweh do to the people he says are like the bad figs?

25.a: He proclaimed the word to all the people of Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
25.q: Who did Jeremiah the prophet proclaim this word to?

25.a: He had been proclaiming them for 23 years.
25.q: How long had Jeremiah been proclaiming Yahweh's words?
How had the people received the words Jeremiah had proclaimed?

25.a: They told each man to turn from his wicked way, not to worship other gods, and not to provoke Yahweh with what they did.
25.q: What did the prophets tell each man?

25.a: Yahweh sent the people of the north with Nebuchadnezzar to destroy them.
25.q: What harm did Yahweh do because they did not listen?

25.a: The sound of celebration and the sound of work will disappear.
25.q: What sounds will disappear from these nations when they serve the king of Babylon for seventy years?

25.a: Yahweh will punish the people of Babylon for their iniquity.
25.q: What will happen in seventy years?

25.a: They will drink it, stumble about, and rant madly.
25.q: What will all the nations do when Yahweh gives them his cup of fury?
What happened after Jerusalem, the cities of Judah, and her kings and officials drank from the cup that Jeremiah gave them?

25.a: Babylon was the last to drink of the cup of Yahweh's fury.
25.q: What was the final nation to drink of the cup of Yahweh's fury?
What will happen if the nations refuse to take the cup from Jeremiah's hand?

25.a: It will kill everyone from one end of the earth to the other.
25.q: Whom will the disaster from Yahweh kill?

25.a: It is their day to die.

25.q: Why were the peaceful pastures destroyed?

26.a: He tells him to proclaim all of Yahweh's words.
26.q: What does Yahweh tell Jeremiah to proclaim in the courtyard?

26.a: If the people listen and turn from their wicked ways, Yahweh will not bring disaster on them.
26.q: What can the people do to get Yahweh not to bring disaster on them?

26.a: Yahweh will turn their city into a curse.
26.q: If the people do not listen to the words of Yahweh, what will Yahweh do to their city?

26.a: The priests, prophets, and people seize him and tell him he will die.
26.q: What happens to Jeremiah after he announces Yahweh's words?

26.a: They take him to the gateway of the New Gate of the temple.
26.q: Where do the people take him to judge him?

26.a: If they kill him, they will be guilty of killing an innocent man.
26.q: What will happen if the officials kill Jeremiah?

26.a: They say that it would be wrong to kill him.
26.q: What do the officials, people, and elders say about killing Jeremiah?

26.a: Micah prophesied that Zion, Jerusalem, and the temple mount would become ruins.
The king tries to kill Uriah.
26.q: What does the king try to do to Uriah?

26.a: Jehoiakim sent men to Egypt to bring Uriah back, then Jehoiakim killed Uriah with the sword.
26.q: How was Jehoiakim able to kill Uriah?

26.a: Ahikam son of Shaphan keeps Jeremiah from being killed.
26.q: Who keeps Jeremiah from being killed?

27.a: He gets a message for the kings of Edom, Moab, Ammon, Tyre, and Sidon.
27.q: Which kings does Jeremiah get a word from Yahweh for?

27.a: All their nations will serve Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon.
27.q: What is the message for the kings?

27.a: Yahweh will punish nations that do not serve Nebuchadnezzar with sword, famine, and plague.
27.q: What will happen to the nations that do not serve Nebuchadnezzar?

27.a: Yahweh will send them away from their land, and they will die.
27.q: What will happen to the people who listen to deceitful prophecy?

27.a: They will stay in their land, cultivate it, and make homes.
27.q: What will the nation that takes the yoke of the king of Babylon receive?

27.a: He needs to serve the King of Babylon.
27.q: What does King Zedekiah need to do if he wants to live?

27.a: Yahweh will drive him out and he will die.
27.q: What will happen to Zedekiah if he listens to his prophets?

27.a: They are not to listen to the prophets. They are to serve the king of Babylon and live.
27.q: What does Jeremiah say to the priests and the people?

27.a: He took Jehoiachin and all the nobles.
27.q: What did Nebuchadnezzar take from Judah and Jerusalem?

27.a: Nebuchadnezzar will take them to Babylon.
27.q: What will happen to the objects in the temple?

28.a: Hananiah said that Yahweh had broken the yoke imposed by the king of Babylon.
28.q: Briefly what did Hananiah say to Jeremiah in front of the priests and people?

28.a: The prophet's words will come true.
28.q: How does one know if a prophet is a true prophet sent by Yahweh?

28.a: He wants the people to believe that they will be free from Babylon.
28.q: Why does Hananiah break the yoke off Jeremiah?

28.a: No, the people will not be free from Babylon.
Yahweh will kill Hananiah this year because Hananiah told the people to rebel against Yahweh.
28.q: What is Yahweh's message through Jeremiah to Hananiah?

29.a: It was sent to all the people exiled to Babylon.
29.q: Who did Jeremiah send his scroll to?

29.a: He told them to do this because the exiles would have peace if the city was at peace.
29.q: Why did Yahweh tell the captives to seek the peace of the city where they were exiled and to intercede with Yahweh on behalf of that city?

29.a: He warns them not to listen to dreams or to prophets whom Yahweh did not send.
29.q: What is Yahweh's warning through Jeremiah to the captives?

29.a: He will bring them back to Judah and give them peace.
29.q: What is Yahweh's plan for the captives after seventy years?

29.a: They will find him when they call to him, pray to him, and seek him with all their heart.
Yahweh said he was about to send sword, famine, and disease on them.
29.q: What was Yahweh going to do to the people who stayed in the city and did not go out into captivity?

29.a: He will hand them over to Nebuchadnezzar, who will kill them.
29.q: What does Yahweh say he will do to Ahab and Zedekiah?

29.a: They will say, "May Yahweh make you like Zedekiah and Ahab, whom the king of Babylon roasted in fire."
29.q: What curse will the captives of Judah in Babylon speak?

29.a: He will have them killed because of the shameful things they did.
29.q: Why will Yahweh have Ahab and Zedekiah killed?
Where was Shemaiah when he wrote the letters?
Where were the people to whom Shemaiah wrote the letters?

29.a: He wanted Zephaniah to make prisoners of the prophets.
29.q: What did Shemaiah want Zephaniah to do?

29.a: Jeremiah had said that the people would be in Babylon for a long time.
29.q: Why did Shemaiah want Zephaniah to rebuke Jeremiah?

29.a: He will do it because Shemaiah prophesied lies to the people so they would rebel against Yahweh.
29.q: Why will Yahweh punish Shemaiah and his descendants?

30.a: He will restore their fortunes and bring them back to the land.
30.q: What will Yahweh do for his people?

30.a: Yahweh, speaking of himself as "we," was the one who heard the voice.
30.q: Who heard the "trembling voice of dread"?

30.a: The descendants of Jacob will have a time of anxiety.
30.q: Why do the young men have their hands on their loins and have pale faces?

30.a: They will worship Yahweh their God and serve David their king.
30.q: How will the Israelites celebrate being freed from enslavement?

30.a: Yahweh will bring them back from where he had scattered them to be captives.
30.q: Why should the descendants of Jacob not be dismayed?
How can Israel's wound be cured?

30.a: Yahweh disciplines the Israelites because of their iniquities and sins.
30.q: Why does Yahweh discipline the Israelites?

30.a: He will have their enemies consume and capture and plunder them.
30.q: What will Yahweh do to those who harmed Israel?
What will Yahweh do for Israel?

30.a: They will sing songs of praise, they will increase in number, and Yahweh will honor them.
30.q: What will the people do after the city has been rebuilt?

30.a: He will appoint a leader for Israel.
30.q: What will Yahweh do after he establishes Israel's assembly?

31.a: He will be the God of all the clans of Israel.
They found favor because Yahweh loved them with an everlasting love.
31.q: Why did the people of Israel who survived the sword find Yahweh's favor?

31.a: She will go out with happy dances and have good crops.
31.q: What will virgin Israel do after Yahweh builds her up?

31.a: He has rescued the remnant of Israel.
He will bring them back from the northern lands and the farthest parts of the earth.
31.q: Where will Yahweh bring the remnant of Israel back from?
Who is "the one who scattered Israel"?

31.a: The people will have plenty of food, wine, oil, and livestock.
31.q: What will be the signs of Yahweh's goodness?
What will the people do when they stop mourning?

31.a: There is wailing and weeping because Rachel's children have died.
31.q: Why is there wailing and bitter weeping in Ramah?

31.a: Yahweh will bring their descendants back from the enemy's land.
31.q: Why should the people stop weeping?

31.a: He will have compassion because Ephraim was ashamed of his sins.
31.q: Why will Yahweh have compassion on Ephraim?

31.a: They will say that because people will live in the cities and farmers and shepherds will live in the country.
31.q: Why will the people say, "May Yahweh bless you"?

31.a: Yahweh will watch over them so he can build them up and plant them.
31.q: What will Yahweh do to the houses of Israel and Judah that he uprooted and tore down?

31.a: The saying is, "Fathers have eaten sour grapes and the children's teeth are dulled."
31.q: What is the saying that the people of Israel and Judah will no longer use?

31.a: Each man will die for his own sin.
31.q: Why will the people no longer use that saying?

31.a: The new covenant is this: Yahweh will write his law on their hearts.
31.q: What is the new covenant that Yahweh will establish with the house of Israel and Judah?

31.a: They will be a nation as long as the sun, moon, stars, and sea have not vanished.
31.q: Israel will be a nation as long as what has not vanished?

31.a: They will be a nation as long as no one has measured the highest heavens or discovered the earth's foundation.
31.q: Yahweh will reject Israel's descendants only when what two things have happened?
When the city is rebuilt, will it be bigger or smaller than it was?

32.a: Jeremiah was imprisoned in the courtyard of the house of the king of Judah.
32.q: Where was Jeremiah when Yahweh gave a message to him?
What was the Babylonian army doing?

32.a: Zedekiah imprisoned him because Jeremiah prophesied that Jerusalem and Zedekiah would be captured by the Babylonians.
Yahweh told Jeremiah that Hanamel son of Shallum your uncle was coming to Jeremiah and would say, "Buy my field that is in Anathoth for yourself, for the right to buy it belongs to you.".
32.q: What did Yahweh say, to Jeremiah, was going to happen?

32.a: Jeremiah signed and sealed the deed of purchase, weighed the silver in the scales, and gave the sealed scroll to Baruch in the presence of the witnesses.
32.q: How did Jeremiah go about buying the field?

32.a: Jeremiah told Baruch to take the scrolls with the receipt of the purchase and place them in a new jar.
32.q: What did Jeremiah tell Baruch to do with the sealed scroll?

32.a: Yahweh wanted all the people to know that people would again buy houses, fields, and vineyards in the land.
32.q: What message of hope did Yahweh want to give through this purchase of land?

32.a: He made the heavens and the earth by his great strength and with his raised arm.
32.q: How did Yahweh make the heavens and the earth?

32.a: He brought the people of Israel out of the land of Egypt.
32.q: How did Yahweh make his name famous?
What did the people of Israel do after Yahweh gave them the land?

32.a: He told him to buy a field.
32.q: What did Yahweh tell Jeremiah to do when the city of Jerusalem was being given into the hand of the Babylonians?

32.a: Yahweh will give him the city.
32.q: Why will Nebuchadnezzar be able to capture the city?

32.a: Jerusalem had been a provocation of Yahweh's wrath since the day that they built it.
32.q: How long had Jerusalem been a provocation to Yahweh?

32.a: They turned their backs on Yahweh, placed wicked things in the temple, built shrines for Baal, and sacrificed their children to Molech.
32.q: What did the people of Israel do to provoke Yahweh?

32.a: He promises to gather them from where they are and bring them back to the land.
32.q: What does Yahweh promise to do for the people of Judah even though they have been wicked?

32.a: He will give them one heart and one way to honor him, and he will establish a perpetual covenant with them.
32.q: How will Yahweh provide for the people of Judah?

32.a: Yahweh said he would bring on them all the good things that he had said he would do for them.
32.q: Just as Yahweh brought disaster on his people, what else was he going to do with them in the future?

33.a: Yahweh tells Jeremiah to call to him.
33.q: What does Yahweh tell Jeremiah to do?

33.a: They are going to fill the houses with corpses.
33.q: What are the Chaldeans (Babylonians) going to do to the houses in the city?

33.a: Yahweh will pardon all the iniquities of the people, heal them, and give them peace.
33.q: What good news does Jeremiah share with the people of Judah?

33.a: Jerusalem will become for Yahweh an object of joy.
33.q: What will the city of Jerusalem become for Yahweh?

33.a: The cities are desolate now, but shepherds will lead their flocks in them.
33.q: How will the cities of Judah change?

33.a: Yahweh has promised to make a descendant of David their king so that he can carry out justice and righteousness in the land.
33.q: What has Yahweh promised to do for the people of Judah and Jerusalem?

33.a: He promises that there will always be a man from David's line to rule Israel and a Leviticus priest to offer sacrifices.

33.q: When will Yahweh break his covenant with David?

33.a: David will have more descendants than anyone can count.
33.q: How many descendants will David have?

33.a: The people have declared that Yahweh has now rejected the two clans that he chose, so they are no longer a nation.
33.q: What have the people declared about Yahweh's punishment of Judah?
When will Yahweh reject the descendants of Jacob?

34.a: Jeremiah received Yahweh's word when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and all of his army were waging war against Jerusalem and her cities.
34.q: When did Jeremiah receive the word from Yahweh?

34.a: He said that he was going to give the city to Nebuchadnezzar.
34.q: What did Yahweh say to Jeremiah?

34.a: He told Zedekiah that he would die in peace.
34.q: What did Yahweh tell Zedekiah king of Judah?

34.a: The people freed all of their servants but later changed their minds and made their servants slaves once again.
34.q: What happened after the leaders and the people in Jerusalem set the Israelite servants free?

34.a: He commanded them to free their slaves every seven years.
34.q: What did Yahweh command the ancestors of the Israelites to do every seven years?

34.a: They set their slaves free, but then they forced them to become slaves again.
34.q: What evil did the people of Judah do?

34.a: They will die by the sword, plague, and famine.
They cut a bull in half and walked between the pieces.
34.q: How did the people show that they agreed to the covenant?

34.a: He will hand them over to their enemies, who will kill them.
34.q: How will Yahweh show he is angry with the people of Judah?

34.a: Yahweh will bring the army of the king of Babylon back to wage war against Jerusalem and burn it so that there will be no inhabitants.
34.q: What will happen to the city of Jerusalem?

35.a: Yahweh asked Jeremiah to bring Rechabites to the temple and give them wine to drink.
35.q: What did Yahweh ask Jeremiah to do?

35.a: When offered wine to drink the Rechabites refused to drink it.
35.q: How did the clan of the Rechabites respond when they were offered wine to drink?

35.a: The Rechabites refused to drink any wine, for their ancestor, Jonadab son of Rechab, commanded them, 'Do not drink any wine, neither you nor your descendants, forever.
35.q: Why did the Rechabites refuse to drink wine?

35.a: Jonadab gave them this command because they were to live in tents.
35.q: Why did Jonadab command the Rechabites to not build houses, sow seeds, or plant vineyards?

35.a: The Rechabites had never drunk wine or built houses.
35.q: How did the Rechabites respond to Jonadab's command?

35.a: They were escaping the Chaldean and Aramean armies.
35.q: Why were the Rechabites living in Jerusalem

35.a: Yahweh wanted the men of Judah to obey him the same way the Rechabites obeyed Jonadab.
35.q: How did Yahweh use the Rechabites as a positive example for the men of Judah?

35.a: The prophets told them to stop doing evil, start doing good, stop worshiping other gods, and come back to the land.
35.q: What did the prophets tell the men of Judah?

35.a: Yahweh will bring on them all the disasters he has proclaimed against them.
35.q: What will Yahweh do because the men of Judah have not obeyed him?

35.a: Yahweh promises that there will always be someone from their family to serve him.
35.q: What promise does Yahweh give to the family of the Rechabites through Jeremiah?

36.a: Yahweh wanted Jeremiah to write his words on a scroll so that the people of Judah would listen to Yahweh and Yahweh could forgive their sin.
36.q: Why did Yahweh want Jeremiah to write his words on a scroll?

36.a: Jeremiah commanded Baruch to take the scroll with Jeremiah's words and read it to Baruch's family and to the people of Judah.
36.q: What did Jeremiah command Baruch to do?

36.a: Jeremiah hoped that the people would listen and turn from their wicked ways.
36.q: Why did Jeremiah want Baruch to read the scroll?

36.a: Baruch read Jeremiah's words in the temple so all the people could hear them.
36.q: What happened during the fast that was proclaimed in honor of Yahweh?

36.a: He went to the secretary's office in the palace.
36.q: What did Micaiah do when he heard Baruch read from the scroll?

36.a: They sent Jehudi to bring Baruch to them, and they had Baruch read the scroll to them.
36.q: What did the officials do when they heard Micaiah's report?

36.a: The men who had heard Baruch read were afraid and decided they must report his words to the king.
36.q: What happened after Baruch read from the scroll?

36.a: They told him that he and Jeremiah needed to hide and not let anyone know where they were.
36.q: What advice did the officials give to Baruch after he told them that he had written Jeremiah's words on the scroll?

36.a: The king cut off the parts Jehudi had read and threw them in the fire until all the scroll was destroyed.
36.q: How did the king respond to the reading of the scroll by Jehudi?

36.a: They were not frightened, nor did they tear their clothes.
36.q: How did the king and his servants show that they would not obey the words in the scroll?

36.a: He did not listen to them.
36.q: What did the king do when several men urged him not to burn the scroll?

36.a: He told Jeremiah to have Baruch write on a new scroll all the words that were on the original scroll.
36.q: What did Yahweh tell Jeremiah to do after the king had burned the scroll?

36.a: He said he would not let any of Jehoiakim's descendants be king, and he would make sure no one buried Jehoiakim's corpse.
36.q: What did Yahweh say he would do to Jehoiakim?

37.a: Zedekiah did not listen to the words of Yahweh.
37.q: How did King Zedekiah respond to Jeremiah when he proclaimed the words of Yahweh?

37.a: They asked him to pray to Yahweh for them.
37.q: What did King Zedekiah and Zephaniah ask Jeremiah to do?

37.a: They wanted to get away from Pharaoh's army, which was coming out of Egypt.
37.q: Why did the Chaldeans (Babylonians) leave Jerusalem?

37.a: They were going to help the people of Judah by fighting the Chaldeans.
37.q: Why was Pharaoh's army coming out of Egypt?

37.a: He said that the Chaldeans would return, fight against the city, capture it, and burn it.
37.q: What did Yahweh tell Jeremiah would happen after Pharaoh's army returned to Egypt?

37.a: He left to take possession of some land.
Jeriah thought that Jeremiah was deserting to the Chaldeans(Babylonians).
37.q: What did Jeriah think that Jeremiah was going to do?

37.a: Jeriah took Jeremiah to the officials, who beat him and put him in prison.
37.q: What did Jeriah do when Jeremiah told him that he was not deserting to the Chaldeans?

37.a: Jeremiah told Zedekiah that Yahweh would give Zedekiah to the king of Babylon.
37.q: How did Jeremiah answer King Zedekiah when Zedekiah asked if Jeremiah has a word from Yahweh?

37.a: He was afraid that he would die there.
37.q: Why did Jeremiah not want to return to the house of Jonathan the scribe?

37.a: He had his servants put Jeremiah in the courtyard of the guard.
37.q: How did King Zedekiah respond to Jeremiah's request?

38.q: What will happen to the city?

38.a: They will die from the sword, famine, and plague.
38.q: What will happen to the people who stay in the city?

38.a: They can stay alive by going out to the Chaldeans.
They wanted him to die because he was telling the soldiers to desert to the Chaldeans.
38.q: Why did the officials want Jeremiah to die?

38.a: They put him in a cistern.
38.q: What did the officials do to Jeremiah?

38.a: He told the king, the officials had done evil with the way they treated Jeremiah the prophet. They threw him into a cistern for him to die in it from hunger.
38.q: What did Ebed Melech tell the king concerning Jeremiah?

38.a: King Zedekiah commanded Ebed Melech to take thirty men and get Jeremiah out of the cistern before Jeremiah died.
38.q: What did king Zedekiah command Ebed Melech concerning Jeremiah?

38.a: He thought Zedekiah would kill him.
38.q: What did Jeremiah think Zedekiah would do if Jeremiah tells him the truth?

38.a: Zedekiah swore by Yahweh that he would not kill him.
38.q: How did Zedekiah persuade Jeremiah to give him an answer?

38.a: Jeremiah told Zedekiah that if he went out to the Chaldeans he would live, but if he did not, he and the city would be destroyed.
38.q: What did Jeremiah say to Zedekiah?

38.a: He was afraid that Nebuchadnezzar would allow them to treat him badly.
38.q: Why was King Zedekiah afraid of the people of Judah who had deserted to the Chaldeans?

38.a: He told King Zedekiah that if Zedekiah obeyed the message from Yahweh, Nebuchadnezzar would not allow the people to treat Zedekiah badly.
38.q: What assurance did Jeremiah give to King Zedekiah?

38.a: They would rebuke and taunt him.
38.q: What would the women do if Zedekiah refused to go out?

38.a: He told Jeremiah to tell them that Jeremiah went to plead with him not to return Jeremiah to Jonathan's house to die.
38.q: What did Zedekiah tell Jeremiah to say to anyone who asked him what he and Zedekiah talked about?

38.a: Jeremiah told them what Zedekiah told him to say.
38.q: What happened when the officials from the house of Judah questioned Jeremiah?

39.q: Who came with his army against Jerusalem and attacked it?

39.a: The city of Jerusalem was broken into.
All the officials of the king of Babylon came and sat in the middle gate.
39.q: Who came and sat in the middle gate?

39.a: They fled at night from the city.
39.q: What did Zedekiah and all his fighting men do when they saw the officials of the king of Babylon in the middle gate?

39.a: They captured him and brought him to Nebuchadnezzar.
39.q: What did the army of the Chaldeans (Babylonians) do when they caught up with Zedekiah?

39.a: He slaughtered Zedekiah's sons and also slaughtered all the noblemen of Judah.
39.q: What did Nebuchadnezzar do when Zedekiah was brought to him?

39.a: He put out Zedekiah's eyes and bound him so he could take Zedekiah to Babylon.
39.q: What did the king of Babylon do to Zedekiah?
What did the Chaldeans (Babylonians) do to the houses and walls of Jerusalem?

39.a: He took into exile the rest of the people who were left in the city and the people who had deserted to the Chaldeans.
39.q: Whom did Nebuzaradan take into exile?

39.a: He allowed the poorest people to remain.
39.q: What people did Nebuzaradan allow to stay in the land of Judah?

39.a: Nebuzaradan gave vineyards and fields to the people who remained.
39.q: What did Nebuzaradan give to the people who remained?

39.a: Nebuchadnezzar told Nebuzaradan to take care of Jeremiah and to do anything Jeremiah told him to do.
39.q: What did Nebuchadnezzar command Nebuzaradan to do about Jeremiah?

39.a: They took Jeremiah from the courtyard of the guard and entrusted him to Gedaliah to take Jeremiah home.
39.q: What did Nebuzaradan, Nergal Sharezer, and the most important officials of the king of Babylon do to Jeremiah?

39.a: Yahweh told Jeremiah to say to Ebed Melech the Cushite that Yahweh was about to bring disaster on the city.
39.q: What did Yahweh tell Jeremiah to say to Ebed Melech the Cushite?

39.a: He said that he would rescue Ebed Melech.
39.q: What did Yahweh say would happen to Ebed Melech on the day that Yahweh carried out his words against the city?

39.a: He would rescue Ebed Melech because he trusted in Yahweh.
39.q: For what reason would Yahweh rescue Ebed Melech from the sword?

40.a: The word from Yahweh came to Jeremiah after Nebuzaradan had sent him away from Ramah.
40.q: What came to Jeremiah after Nebuzaradan had sent him away from Ramah?

40.a: He was going to send them to Babylon.
40.q: What was Nebuzaradan going to do with the people of Jerusalem and Judah?

40.a: The chief guard said that Yahweh had decreed the disaster against that place.
40.q: Why did the chief guard tell Jeremiah concerning Yahweh and Jerusalem?

40.a: He said that Jeremiah could go with him to Babylon or go wherever he wanted to in the land.
40.q: Where did the chief guard say that Jeremiah could go?

40.a: He said that Jeremiah should go to Gedaliah, who was in charge of the cities of Judah.
40.q: To whom did the chief guard say that Jeremiah should go?

40.a: Jeremiah went to Gedaliah and lived among the people who were left behind in the land.
40.q: Where did Jeremiah go and live?

40.a: They went to Gedaliah at Mizpah.
40.q: What did the commanders of the Judean soldiers and their men do when they heard that Gedaliah had been put in charge of those who had not been exiled to Babylon?

40.a: He said that if they would serve the Chaldean officials and the king of Babylon and live in the land it would go well with them.
40.q: What did Gedaliah tell the commanders of the Judean soldiers and their men to do?

40.a: He told them that they should live in the cities that they had occupied.
40.q: What did Gedaliah tell the commanders of the Judean soldiers and their men to do so they could harvest wine, summer fruit, and oil?

40.a: The Judeans returned to Judah from every place where they had been scattered, and they harvested wine and summer fruit in great abundance.
40.q: What did the Judeans do when they heard that the king of Babylon had allowed a remnant of Judah to stay?

40.a: They asked him if he realized that Baalis king of Ammon had sent Ishmael to murder him.
40.q: What did Johanan and all the army commanders ask Gedaliah at Mizpah?
What did Gedaliah think about what Jonathan and the army commanders told him?
What did Johanan tell Gedaliah he wanted to do?

40.a: Gedaliah thought that Jonathan was telling lies about Ishmael.
40.q: What did Gedaliah think of Jonathan's words about Ishmael?

41.q: Why did Ishmael and the ten men with him come to eat with Gedaliah?

41.a: They killed Gedaliah, all the Judeans who were with him, and the Chaldean soldiers who were there.
41.q: Whom did Ishmael and his men kill?

41.a: Eighty men came from Shechem, Shiloh, and Samaria.
41.q: Who came on the second day after Ishmael had killed Gedaliah?

41.a: They were going to the temple.
He invited them to visit Gedaliah.
41.q: What did Ishmael say to the eighty men?

41.a: They slaughtered the men and threw them into a pit.
41.q: What did Ishmael and his men do to the eighty men when they came into the city?

41.a: The ten men told them that they had provisions.
41.q: Why did they not kill ten of the eighty men?

41.a: He threw them in the pit that King Asa had dug.
41.q: Where did Ishmael throw the corpses of all the people he had killed??

41.a: Ishmael captured all the other people who were in Mizpah and started to take them to Ammon.
41.q: What did Ishmael do with all the other people who were in Mizpah?

41.a: They took all their men and went to fight against Ishmael.
41.q: What did Johanan and all the army commanders with him do when they heard of what Ishmael had done?

41.a: They were very happy and went to Johanan.
41.q: What did all the people who were with Ishmael do when they saw Johanan and all the army commanders who were with him?

41.a: They went to the people of Ammon.
41.q: Where did Ishmael and his men go to get away from Johanan?

41.a: They went to Geruth Chimham, which is near Bethlehem.
41.q: Where did Johanan and the people go after they left Mizpah?

41.a: They wanted to go to Egypt.
41.q: Where did Johanan and the people want to go?

41.a: They were afraid of the Chaldeans.
41.q: Why did they want to go to Egypt?

41.a: They were afraid because Ishmael had killed Gedaliah.
41.q: Why were Johanan and the people afraid of the Chaldeans?

42.a: They asked him to pray for them and to tell them the way they should go and what they should do.
42.q: What did all the army commanders and all the people say to Jeremiah?

42.a: He said he would pray for them and tell them whatever Yahweh answers.
They said they would do everything Yahweh told them to do.
42.q: Then what did the people say to Jeremiah?

42.a: After ten days, the word of Yahweh came to Jeremiah.
He said that he would save them, give them mercy and compassion, and bring them back to their land.
42.q: What did Yahweh say he would do because he was with them?

42.a: If they went to live in Egypt, Yahweh said they would all die there by sword, famine, and plague.
42.q: What did Yahweh say would happen if the people actually went to Egypt to live there?

42.a: They will become an object of cursing and they will never return.
42.q: What will become of them if they go to Egypt?

42.a: Yahweh has told them not to go to Egypt, and he will be angry with them if they go.
42.q: Why will the people never see the land again?

42.a: They will pay with their lives because they asked Jeremiah to give them Yahweh's message, but they will not do what Yahweh tells them to do.
42.q: Why will the people pay for their lives for going to Egypt?

43.a: He finished proclaiming all the words that Yahweh had told him to say.
43.q: What did Jeremiah finish proclaiming to all the people?

43.a: They accused him of telling them lies so that Jeremiah could have the Chaldeans kill them and make them captives in Babylon.
43.q: Of what did Azariah, Johanan, and all the arrogant men accuse Jeremiah?
What did Johanan and the others do instead of what Yahweh had told them to do?

43.a: He told him to bury them near Pharaoh's house in Tahpanhes to show that Nebuchadnezzar would sit on a throne there.
43.q: What did Yahweh tell Jeremiah to do with the stones?

43.a: Yahweh says that Nebuchadnezzar will kill some people and take others into captivity.
43.q: What does Yahweh say will happen to the people when Nebuchadnezzar comes and attacks the land of Egypt?

43.a: Yahweh says he will burn them or capture them.
43.q: What does Yahweh say Nebuchadnezzar will do to the temples of Egypt's gods?

44.a: Jeremiah says did it because the people worshiped other gods.
44.q: Why does Jeremiah say Yahweh brought disaster on Jerusalem and the cities of Judah?

44.a: The prophets had told the people to stop doing things that Yahweh hates.
44.q: What had Yahweh's prophets said to the people?
What did the people do after the prophets spoke to them?

44.a: Yahweh poured out his fury and his wrath, and he destroyed Judah and Jerusalem.
44.q: What did Yahweh do when the Judeans did not listen to the prophets?

44.a: He will not allow any of them to live.
44.q: How many of the people who went to Egypt will Yahweh allow to live?

44.a: They offended Yahweh with the deeds of their hands, by burning incense to other gods in the land of Egypt.
He says he will destroy them.
44.q: What does Yahweh say is going to happen to them in Egypt?

44.a: He says that the people and their ancestors have committed wickedness.
44.q: Who does Yahweh say has committed wickedness?

44.a: Yahweh says that he will set his face against them and bring disaster to them and destroy all of them just as he punished Jerusalem: with sword and famine and plague.
44.q: What does Yahweh say will happen to the people who went to Egypt?

44.a: He says that none of them who want to return to Judah will return, though a few will escape from Egypt.
44.q: What does Yahweh say about the remnant of Judah?

44.a: The people thought they would be filled with food and would prosper, without experiencing any disaster if they burned incense and poured out drink offerings to the Queen of Heaven.
44.q: What did the people think would happen if they continued to burned incense and pour out drink offerings to the Queen of Heaven?

44.a: He could no longer bear what the people did.
44.q: What was it that Yahweh could no longer bear?

44.a: Their land became a desolation, a horror, and a curse.
44.q: What happened to their land after Yahweh could no longer bear what the people did?

44.a: Because they burned incense to worship idols and sinned against Yahweh, and because they would not listen to him.
44.q: Why did this disaster happen to them?

44.a: He told them to fulfill their vows.
44.q: What did Jeremiah tell those who wanted to fulfill their vows to the Queen of Heaven?

44.a: He told them that they would never again worship Yahweh, but they would all perish by sword and famine.
44.q: What did Jeremiah say the people would do after they fulfilled their vows?

44.a: They will return from Egypt to Judah.
44.q: What will happen to those who do not die by the sword?

44.a: He says he will give Pharaoh Hophra to his enemies.
44.q: What does Yahweh say he will do with Pharaoh Hophra?

44.a: They will understand that Yahweh will do to them everything he said he would do.
44.q: What will the people understand when Hophra dies?

45.a: He did it because Baruch was saying that Yahweh was making him sad.
45.q: Why did Yahweh give Jeremiah a message for Baruch?
What does Yahweh plan to do to Baruch's nation?

45.a: He should not desire people to honor him in a special way.
Yahweh promises to protect Baruch wherever he goes.
45.q: What does Yahweh promise to do for Baruch?

46.a: Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and Neco king of Egypt were going to war.
46.q: Who are the two kings who are going to have a war?

46.a: He tells them to get their shields, horses, spears, and armor ready and go forward to fight.
46.q: What does Yahweh tell the army of Egypt to do?

46.a: He sees the Egyptian soldiers running for safety but defeated at the Euphrates River.
46.q: What does Yahweh see the Egyptian army doing?

46.a: The army is like the Nile River when it floods and destroys cities and inhabitants.
46.q: What does Yahweh compare the Egyptian army to?

46.a: He will get his vengeance when the sword devours and is satisfied. That will be like a sacrifice to Yahweh.
46.q: How will Yahweh get his vengeance?

46.a: They are to go to Gilead for medicine, but it will not cure them.
46.q: What does Yahweh tell Egypt to do?

46.a: He told them to got to Tahpanhes and fight there.
46.q: What did Yahweh tell the people of Migdol and Memphis to do?

46.a: Apis the bull-god has run away and Yahweh has thrown him down.
46.q: What has happened to Egypt's gods?

46.a: They want to go to their homes.
46.q: What do the soldiers want to do?

46.a: He says Egypt needs to prepare for captivity.
46.q: What does Yahweh say Egypt needs to prepare for?

46.a: Egypt is a beautiful young cow, and the hired soldiers are like a fattened bull.
46.q: What animals does the writer say Egypt is like before the battle?

46.a: He says Egypt is like a snake.
46.q: What animal does the writer say Egypt is like after the battle?

46.a: People from the north will cut them down.
46.q: Who will kill the soldiers of Egypt?

46.a: He will give Egypt to Nebuchadnezzar.
46.q: To whom will Yahweh give Egypt?

46.a: He will bring them out of captivity, return them to their land where they will find peace and be secure, bring destruction to the nations where they were scattered, discipline them justly, but not destroy them completely.
46.q: What does Yahweh say he will do for his people Israel?

47.a: They will be attacked from the north and they will all lament(weep).
47.q: What does Yahweh say will happen to the people of Philistia?

47.a: They will hear the sound of horses' hooves and the rumble of the chariots. Men will run away, they will not stop to help their children, and they will be weak and helpless.
47.q: How will the people of Philistia know the enemy is coming to destroy them?

47.a: They are asking him to stop killing them.
47.q: What are the people of Philistia asking Yahweh to do?

47.a: Because he intends to attack all people living in Ashkelon and the cities along the coast.
47.q: Why will Yahweh not stop the killing?

48.a: Devastation will happen to the cities, no one will honor Moab, and their enemies will try to destroy her as a nation.
48.q: What does Yahweh say about Moab?

48.a: They are doing these things because Moab has been destroyed.
48.q: Why are people screaming, weeping, and crying?

48.a: They were putting their trust in their practices and their wealth.
48.q: Why will Chemosh and his priests and leaders go away into captivity?

48.a: They will all be destroyed, none of them will escape.
48.q: What does Yahweh say will happen to the towns in Moab?

48.a: They will become a wasteland where no one lives.
48.q: What is to happen to their cities?

48.a: Yahweh will curse him.
48.q: What will Yahweh do to anyone who will not kill Moabites for him?

48.a: He says he will send enemies to attack them and get rid of them.
48.q: What does Yahweh say will happen to the Moabites?

48.a: It will very soon be destroyed.
48.q: What does Yahweh say will happen to the country of Moab?

48.a: They should wail for Moab because their power has been broken.
48.q: What should the people who live near Moab do after Moab is destroyed?

48.a: They should notice they are being attacked and take notice of people who are escaping. They should howl, lament, and shout for help because Moab has been devastated.
48.q: What should the people in the city of Dibon and Aroer do instead of being proud?

48.a: Yahweh has punished many cities. The horn of Moab has been hacked off; its arm has been broken.
48.q: What punishment has come to all the cities in the land of Moab?

48.a: Yahweh will judge Moab and their enemies will laugh at them.
48.q: The Moabites thought they were powerful against Yahweh, but what will Yahweh do to them?

48.a: They should abandon the cities and camp on the cliffs in the rocks.
48.q: What should the inhabitants do because of their pride?

48.a: Yahweh laments because he knows Moab's defiant speech amounts to nothing.
48.q: Why does Yahweh lament, shout in sorrow, and weep for the people in Moab?

48.a: He has taken away their celebration and rejoicing.
48.q: What has Yahweh done to Moab?

48.a: He will get rid of those people.
48.q: What does Yahweh say he will do to the people of Moab who offer sacrifices and burn incense to their gods?

48.a: They shave their heads and beards, cut their hands, and wear sackcloth around their waists.
48.q: How do the people of Kir Heres express their sorrow because their riches are gone?

48.a: Because Yahweh has destroyed Moab as people destroy pots that no one wants.
48.q: Why is there mourning everywhere on the roofs and in the plazas?

48.a: It will happen quickly, like when an eagle gets its prey. The enemy will seize the strongholds, and the soldiers will be afraid.
48.q: What does Yahweh say the capture of Kerioth will be like?

48.a: Yahweh will cause the people to be terrified and fall into pits and traps.
48.q: How will Yahweh destroy Moab?

48.a: Because a fire will be burning in Heshbon, and it will burn up all the people in Moab who boasted.
48.q: Why will the people flee only as far as the city of Heshbon?

48.a: The Moabites will be destroyed and their sons and daughters will be captured and taken to other countries, but someday Yahweh will allow them to return to their land.
48.q: What does Jeremiah say will happen to the Moabites?

49.a: Molech should not occupy Gad because it belongs to the children of Israel.
49.q: Why should Molech not occupy the land of Gad?

49.a: It will become a deserted heap.
49.q: What will happen to Rabbah?

49.a: The cities will be destroyed and the people will go into captivity.
49.q: What will happen to Molech?

49.a: She trusts in her wealth.
49.q: What does the faithless daughter trust in?

49.a: They will be terrified because they will all be forced by the enemy who surround them to scatter to other countries.
49.q: Why will the people be terrified?

49.a: Yahweh will restore their fortunes.
49.q: What will Yahweh do for the Ammon people-group in the future?

49.a: The wise people of Edom have gone away.
49.q: What has happened to the wise people of Edom?

49.a: They should flee and live in holes in the ground.
49.q: What should the people of Edom do now that their wise people are gone?

49.a: He is going to bring disaster on Esau.
49.q: What is Yahweh going to do to Esau?

49.a: He says that he will take care of the orphans and widows.
49.q: What does Yahweh say about the orphans and widows in Edom?

49.a: They have seen that even those whom Yahweh is not punishing have suffered.
49.q: Why should the Edomites already know that Yahweh will punish them?

49.a: He will destroy it.
49.q: What Yahweh said he will do to Bozrah?

49.a: The messenger went out to the nations telling them to get ready for battle and attack Edom.
49.q: What was Yahweh's messenger going to tell the nations to do?

49.a: He says that he has made their nation of Edom small compared to other nations and that people will despise them.
49.q: What does Yahweh say to the people of Edom?

49.a: He will bring them down.
49.q: Because the Edomites have deceived themselves and think they have safety in the cliff, what will Yahweh do to them?

49.a: He compares it to Sodom and Gomorrah and their neighbors, where no one lives.
49.q: What does Yahweh compare the horror of Edom to?

49.a: He will choose someone to be in charge of them.
49.q: What will Yahweh do to the Edomites after he takes them from their land?

49.a: He has plans to drag away the inhabitants of Teman and to turn their pasturelands into ruined places.
49.q: What are the plans that Yahweh has against Edom?

49.a: The earth will shake, and people as far away as the Red Sea will hear the shouts of distress. Even the strongest warriors will be afraid.
49.q: What will it be like when Edom is destroyed?

49.a: They will be ashamed and weak. They will turn away and flee in distress.
49.q: What does Yahweh say will happen to the people of Damascus?

49.a: The fire will devour Benhadad's strongholds, and the young men and all the fighting men will die.
49.q: What will happen when Yahweh lights a fire on the wall of Damascus?

49.a: He tells Nebuchadnezzar to attack the people, destroy them, and take their possessions.
49.q: What does Yahweh tell Nebuchadnezzar to do to Kedar?

49.a: It will be easy for him because the people have no gates or bars, and they live by themselves.
49.q: Why will this be an easy attack for Nebuchadnezzar?

49.a: They will live in holes in the ground.
49.q: Where will the people of Kedar live after Nebuchadnezzar attacks them?

49.a: He will scatter them and disaster will come on them.
49.q: What will Yahweh do to the people of Hazor when Nebuchadnezzar takes their camels and property as war plunder?

49.a: Only jackals will live in it.
49.q: Who will live in the city after Nebuchadnezzar attacks it?

49.a: He got it when King Zedekiah ruled Judah.
49.q: When did Jeremiah receive the prophecy about Elam?

49.a: The people will go to all parts of the earth.
49.q: When Yahweh breaks the bowmen of Elam, where will the people go?

49.a: Yahweh is going to enable their enemies to smash them and bring disaster to them, kill them, and completely get rid of all of them.
49.q: What is Yahweh going to do because he is angry with the people of Elam?

49.a: He will allow them to return to their land.
49.q: What will Yahweh do for the people of Elam some day?

50.a: Babylon is taken. Bel and the idols are put to shame.
50.q: What will happen to Babylon?

50.a: A nation from the north.
50.q: Who will arise against Babylon?

50.a: The people will come together with weeping and seek Yahweh. They will set off toward Zion to renew their eternal covenant with Yahweh.
50.q: What will the people of Israel do when Babylon is attacked?

50.a: He describes them as a lost flock because their shepherds led them astray and they forgot their homeland.
50.q: Why does Yahweh describe his people as a lost flock?

50.a: The adversaries said it was because Yahweh's people sinned against Yahweh.
50.q: What did their adversaries say about why they were able to devour Yahweh's people?

50.a: They are to leave because great nations from the north are coming to capture Babylon.
50.q: Why are the Israelites to leave Babylon before Babylon is captured?

50.a: Babylon will be the least of nations, an uninhabited wilderness.
50.q: What will happen to Babylon because they took Yahweh's inheritance as plunder?

50.a: Everyone will shoot at Babylon, Babylon will surrender her power, her towers will fall, her walls will be torn down, and others will do to her just as she had done to other nations.
50.q: Because Babylon has sinned against Yahweh what will happen to her?

50.a: They should all run away back to their own countries.
50.q: What should people who came from other countries do when Babylon is attacked?

50.a: He says he will punish the king of Babylon and his people the same way he punished the king of Assyria.
50.q: What does Yahweh say he will do to the nations of Assyria and Babylon?

50.a: Yahweh will restore Israel to his homeland, and he will forgive the people's sins.
50.q: What will Yahweh do for this remnant of people that he spares?
